contradictions.description: Minimal work hours (4.0h/day) but low job satisfaction. May indicate underemployment or disengagement.
contradictions.explanation: Part-time hours with dissatisfaction suggests role mismatch, underutilization, or financial stress from insufficient work.
contradictions.recommendation: Clarify if this is desired part-time or forced underemployment. If latter, explore full-time opportunities or additional income streams.

recommendations.advice: Improve sleep: maintain consistent schedule, create bedtime routine, avoid screens 1h before bed, keep bedroom cool and dark, limit caffeine after 2pm
recommendations.rationale: Sleep is foundation of mental and physical health. Most adults need 7-9h for optimal functioning.

recommendations.advice: Address job dissatisfaction: identify specific dissatisfaction sources, discuss with manager, explore growth opportunities, consider career counseling
recommendations.rationale: Job dissatisfaction affects all life domains. Early intervention can prevent burnout or misguided career changes.

recommendations.advice: Increase activity: aim for 30min moderate exercise daily (brisk walk counts), take movement breaks every hour, use stairs, park farther away
recommendations.rationale: Regular exercise reduces stress, improves mood, and enhances cognitive function. Small changes compound over time.

behavioral_interventions.evidence: 📊 Data insight: Users who increased sleep from <7h to 7-8h saw 31% reduction in stress scores within 2 weeks
specific_actions: Set a bedtime alarm for 1.6h earlier than usual
Create a wind-down routine: dim lights 1h before bed, no screens 30min before
Keep consistent sleep schedule (even weekends) - irregular sleep disrupts circadian rhythm

behavioral_interventions.evidence: 📊 Data insight: Therapy intervention participants showed stress reduction in 4-6 sessions. Meditation programs (48 completers) reduced stress over 2-4 weeks
specific_actions: Start 10-min daily meditation (Headspace, Calm, Insight Timer) - reduces cortisol by 23% in 8 weeks
Box breathing during stress spikes: 4s inhale → 4s hold → 4s exhale → 4s hold (5 rounds)
Consider EAP (Employee Assistance Program) or therapist - stress management is a learned skill

behavioral_interventions.evidence: 📊 Data insight: Meditation intervention participants improved sleep quality by average 2.3 points over 6-8 weeks
specific_actions: Try 4-7-8 breathing before bed: inhale 4s, hold 7s, exhale 8s (repeat 4x)
No caffeine after 2pm (6-hour half-life fragments REM sleep)
Keep bedroom cool (65-68°F) and dark - temperature drop signals sleep onset

behavioral_interventions.evidence: 📊 Data insight: Exercise plan intervention - participants averaging 30+min daily had 23% lower anxiety scores vs sedentary group
specific_actions: Start small: add 30min walking during lunch break
Movement snacks: 5-min walks every 2 hours (breaks cortisol accumulation)
Commute hack: park farther away, take stairs, get off bus 1 stop early
